data.title: Week in Indiana History
data.text:
April 3, 1926Â Â Virgil “Gus” Grissom was born in Mitchell, Indiana.Â He became an Air Force pilot and one of the first astronauts.Â In 1967, he and two others were killed in testing for the Apollo I mission.

1962Â Â Robert Wise won Academy Awards for best director and best picture forÂ West Side Story.Â Born in Winchester, Indiana, he attended Franklin College.Â In Hollywood, he became an acclaimed film editor, producer, and director.Â He alsoÂ won Oscars in 1965 for best director and best picture forÂ The Sound of Music.

April 8, 1990Â Â Ryan White died at age 18 in Indianapolis.Â An AIDS patient, his courageous struggle for acceptance gained national attention.Â Shortly after his death, Congress passed the Ryan White Care Act, which providesÂ services for people living with HIV/AIDS.

1968Â Â Â Â Robert F. Kennedy, in Indianapolis on a campaign tour, announced the death of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., to a crowd at 17th and Broadway.Â His impassioned plea for peace on that night is considered one of the best public addresses of the era.

Happy National Grilled Cheese Sandwich Month!

Indiana Quick Quiz

1. How many pounds of popcorn is grown in Indiana each year?

2. Indiana is second behind what state in popcorn production?

3. How much popcorn is consumed by Americans each year?

4. When is the earliest known evidence of popcorn being popped?

5. What year were popcorn machines first installed in movie theaters?

Answers Below

Did You Know???

The Indiana Statehouse is a beautifulÂ and economicalÂ wedding venue.

Answers

1. 500 million

2. Nebraska

3. 17 billon quarts

4. In Peru 4700 BC

5. 1938
